CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 19, 1951, pg. 8, reads: "Mayor Gets BTW Coin in Camp Drive - W. M. Sheridan, far right, secretary of the Commonwealth Trust Company, presents Mayor David L. Lawrence, far left, with a Booker T. Washington memorial half-dollar as a token of gratitude for his support of the drive for funds for Camp Achievement, while Mrs. Myra Johns, chairman of the board of directors of the Achievement Club, and Mrs. Alma Illery, president and founder of the group, look on. A. Donovan Faust, assistant general manager of television station WDTV, third from left, has arranged for a TV appeal for the camp drive on May 21. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence accepting a Booker T. Washington memorial half dollar from W. M. Sheridan, while Myra Johns, A. Donovan Faust, and Alma Illery look on, in mayor's office, City County Building
